Hi, reading parts of junit recipes (*lots* of good stuff). I want to
refact=
or a bunch of common tests into base test classes that follow one of
my cla=
ss hierarchies. But I need to enforce the order of the tests (I know
it's n=
ot normal, but I am testing crud with dao's). It seems as soon as I
use sui=
te() to control the order, junit does not find the tests in the
super-class=
es of that test case.

I am using the textui runner from main()in each base=
 test case in eclipse.
(but would like to be able to use different test run=
ners, run the tests from
ant etc.)

Having each suite do an addTest(SuperCl=
ass.suite()) seems to fix the
problem.

But iirc, there is some problem wit=
h different test runners or something
that will not look for a suite() meth=
od?

Is there a way to do this so that it works regardless of the test runn=
er and
the environment?

Any pointers will be appreciated

thanks
